title: CoreWeave’s stock has been red hot, but this rival may be a better investment
author: MarketWatch Top Stories
essence: CoreWeave has gained market attention with a recent Meta deal. However, one unnamed Wall Street firm now suggests rival neocloud Nebius offers a superior path for growth and investment. This perspective introduces a potential shift in investment focus within the competitive neocloud sector, challenging CoreWeave's current market perception and highlighting Nebius as an alternative for growth-oriented portfolios.
reactions: ) Investor — thesis/risks: A Wall Street firm sees Nebius offering a "better path for growth" over headline-grabbing CoreWeave, suggesting a contrarian play despite CoreWeave's "red hot" stock and Meta deal.

) Operator — execution lesson: CoreWeave's Meta deal demonstrates the power of securing anchor clients, while Nebius's potential "better path for growth" implies a need for operators to focus on superior product or operational efficiency beyond current market hype.

) Market — who loses if they win: If Nebius truly offers a "better path for growth," CoreWeave's "red hot" stock investors might miss out on superior returns, indicating a potential shift in capital allocation from current darlings to emerging rivals.

title: Show HN: Resterm – A terminal-based REST/GraphQL and gRPC client
author: Y Combinator
essence: Resterm launched as a new terminal-based client for REST, GraphQL, and gRPC. Key features include a workspace explorer, a Vim-style editor with modal workflow, and a status-aware response pane covering Pretty, Raw, Headers, and History tabs. It requires Go 1.22+.
reactions: ) Investor: The investor thesis hinges on capturing a niche of terminal-native, Vim-proficient developers with a comprehensive REST/GraphQL/gRPC client, but risks limited market adoption due to its specialized interface and learning curve for others.

) Operator: An operator should note the deep commitment to a specific user persona (terminal-native, Vim-proficient developers) by integrating a comprehensive feature set and workflow (workspace, modal editor, gRPC/GraphQL support, environment variables) that directly caters to their existing habits and needs.

) Market: If Resterm succeeds, existing less integrated terminal-based tools like `curl`, `HTTPie`, or `grpcurl`, and potentially even GUI clients for developers who prefer a terminal-native, Vim-centric workflow, would see reduced usage among its target audience.

title: Google Ads to enforce new requirements for Message assets
author: Search Engine Land
essence: What's new: Google Ads will begin enforcing new, stricter requirements for Message assets, starting October 30, 2025. Advertisers must update and verify their existing Message assets by this deadline, as enforcement will ramp up over four weeks. Why it matters: This policy change directly impacts advertisers relying on Message assets.
reactions: ) Investor: Google's stricter Message asset enforcement aims to improve ad quality and user experience, strengthening platform stickiness, but presents a short-term risk of revenue disruption from advertisers whose "stalled campaigns" lead to reduced ad spend.

) Operator: Proactive compliance is critical; operators must "review and update their message assets ahead of the deadline to avoid disruptions" like "stalled campaigns, lost visibility, and missed opportunities.

) Market: Non-compliant advertisers will lose campaign reach and visibility to competitors who successfully adapt to Google's new Message asset requirements, experiencing "stalled campaigns" and "missed opportunities.

title: YouTube dominates AI search with 200x citation advantage: Data
author: Search Engine Land
essence: What happened: New BrightEdge data (May 2024-Sept 2025) reveals YouTube overwhelmingly dominates AI search citations, cited 200x more than any other video platform (e.g., Vimeo, TikTok at 0.1%). YouTube holds a 20% average citation  across platforms like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Google AI, and is the top domain in Google AI Overviews at 29.5%. Why it matters: This establishes YouTube as the primary, trusted video authority for AI, making it critical for brands to produce video content there.
reactions: ) Investor: YouTube's 200x citation advantage across AI platforms, making it "essentially the only video source that matters" and a top information authority, solidifies its indispensable strategic value for Google in the evolving AI information landscape.

) Operator: Brands must prioritize creating specific "how-to" tutorials and product-focused video content for YouTube, as "if your brand isn’t creating video content, you may be invisible in AI search" and YouTube is the only video platform AI platforms appear to trust.

) Market: Competitors like TikTok, Vimeo, Dailymotion, and Twitch are effectively rendered "invisible in AI search," losing crucial mindshare and potential traffic as YouTube secures a 200x citation advantage and becomes the "only video platform that AI platforms appear to trust.

title: Google Ads Performance Max gets asset and channel reporting
author: Search Engine Land
essence: Google Ads Performance Max gets asset and channel reporting What's new: Google Ads is rolling out new asset and channel reporting for Performance Max (PMax) campaigns, effective September 30, 2025. This update provides segmentation of asset performance by device, time, conversions, and networks, plus adds ROI columns, cost data, and diagnostics to channel reports. Why it matters: This is a crucial step in demystifying PMax, offering a clearer view of campaign performance.
reactions: ) Investor: Google's move to make Performance Max "feel a lot less like a black box" by adding granular reporting aims to boost advertiser confidence and spend, solidifying its ad platform dominance.

) Market: If advertisers successfully leverage PMax's new transparency to "maximize ROI across Google’s full network," competing ad platforms or less integrated ad strategies could lose budget as spend consolidates.

title: Meta plans to buy chip startup Rivos to boost semiconductor efforts - Reuters

This strategic acquisition aims to reduce Meta's reliance on external chip suppliers, potentially lowering operational costs and enhancing the performance and energy efficiency of its massive AI and metaverse infrastructure.

) Market: Should Meta succeed in its custom semiconductor efforts, existing external chip suppliers like Qualcomm, NVIDIA, and Intel stand to lose significant future orders for Meta's devices and data centers.

Brave Search handles 1.5 billion monthly queries.
